intro: Moullava spicata, commonly known as the spike moullava, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical in shape, with a slightly rough texture. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
